org.eclipse.paho.mqttv5.client

Class MqttTopic

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.paho.mqttv5.client.MqttTopic

  • public class MqttTopic
extends Object
    Represents a topic destination, used for publish/subscribe messaging.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String MULTI_LEVEL_WILDCARD
      Multi-level wildcard The number sign (#) is a wildcard character that matches any number of levels within a topic.
      static String MULTI_LEVEL_WILDCARD_PATTERN
      Multi-level wildcard pattern(/#)
      static String SINGLE_LEVEL_WILDCARD
      Single-level wildcard The plus sign (+) is a wildcard character that matches only one topic level.
      static String TOPIC_LEVEL_SEPARATOR
      The forward slash (/) is used to separate each level within a topic tree and provide a hierarchical structure to the topic space.
      static String TOPIC_WILDCARDS
      Topic wildcards (#+)

    • Field Detail

      • TOPIC_LEVEL_SEPARATOR

        public static final String TOPIC_LEVEL_SEPARATOR
        The forward slash (/) is used to separate each level within a topic tree and provide a hierarchical structure to the topic space. The use of the topic level separator is significant when the two wildcard characters are encountered in topics specified by subscribers.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MULTI_LEVEL_WILDCARD

        Multi-level wildcard The number sign (#) is a wildcard character that matches any number of levels within a topic.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • publish

        public MqttDeliveryToken publish(byte[] payload,
                                 int qos,
                                 boolean retained)
                          throws org.eclipse.paho.mqttv5.common.MqttException,
                                 org.eclipse.paho.mqttv5.common.MqttPersistenceException
        Publishes a message on the topic. This is a convenience method, which will create a new MqttMessage object with a byte array payload and the specified QoS, and then publish it. All other values in the message will be set to the defaults.
        Parameters:
        payload - the byte array to use as the payload
        qos - the Quality of Service. Valid values are 0, 1 or 2.
        retained - whether or not this message should be retained by the server.
        Returns:
        MqttDeliveryToken
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.paho.mqttv5.common.MqttException - If an error occurs publishing the message
        org.eclipse.paho.mqttv5.common.MqttPersistenceException - If an error occurs persisting the message
        IllegalArgumentException - if value of QoS is not 0, 1 or 2.
        See Also:
        publish(MqttMessage), MqttMessage.setQos(int), MqttMessage.setRetained(boolean)

      • publish

        public MqttDeliveryToken publish(org.eclipse.paho.mqttv5.common.MqttMessage message)
                          throws org.eclipse.paho.mqttv5.common.MqttException,
                                 org.eclipse.paho.mqttv5.common.MqttPersistenceException
        Publishes the specified message to this topic, but does not wait for delivery of the message to complete. The returned token can be used to track the delivery status of the message. Once this method has returned cleanly, the message has been accepted for publication by the client. Message delivery will be completed in the background when a connection is available.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to publish
        Returns:
        an MqttDeliveryToken for tracking the delivery of the message
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.paho.mqttv5.common.MqttException - if an error occurs publishing the message
        org.eclipse.paho.mqttv5.common.MqttPersistenceException - if an error occurs persisting the message

        public String getName()
        Returns the name of the queue or topic.

        the name of this destination.

      • validate

        public static void validate(String topicString,
                            boolean wildcardAllowed)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Validate the topic name or topic filter
        Parameters:
        topicString - topic name or filter
        wildcardAllowed - true if validate topic filter, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the topic is invalid

      • isMatched

        public static boolean isMatched(String topicFilter,
                                String topicName)
                         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Check the supplied topic name and filter match
        Parameters:
        topicFilter - topic filter: wildcards allowed
        topicName - topic name: wildcards not allowed
        Returns:
        true if the topic matches the filter
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the topic name or filter is invalid
